dublin_core.dcvalue: A multisite regional telephone care program staffed by advance practice and critical care nurses has improved patient care and reduced unnecessary clinic and emergency room visits It allows patients to access the health care system and receive expert advice through the use of the telephone 24 hours per day 7 days per week Computerized patient medical records from eight hospitals and 31 clinics are available to a registered nurse so that informed decisions can be made The RN records the patient s concern and intervention directly into the patient s medical record which is transmitted to the primary care provider in real time
The Nursing clinics of North America
